meanings.definition: Showing or feeling malice or spite
meanings.sent1: She gave a despiteful glare to her rival in the competition.
meanings.sent2: His despiteful comments hurt her feelings.
meanings.sent3: Despiteful behavior like that won't make you any friends.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered in a despiteful manner, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The despiteful cat hissed at anyone who came near.

meanings.definition: Full of or motivated by spite
meanings.sent1: The despiteful child refused to share his toys with his siblings.
meanings.sent2: Her actions were driven by a despiteful desire to cause trouble.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to have a despiteful plan to steal all the birdseed.
meanings.sent4: The despiteful wind seemed to howl in protest at being ignored.
meanings.sent5: The despiteful look in his eyes made her uneasy.

meanings.sent1: The despiteful student spread rumors about his classmates.
meanings.sent2: She spoke in a despiteful tone that made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The despiteful squirrel stole all the nuts from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The despiteful storm raged on, drenching everything in its path.
meanings.sent5: His despiteful actions caused chaos in the community.
